title: Config

profile.name: ownCloud
profile.about: ownCloud GmbH is the company behind the ownCloud Project - the most downloaded open source project for data and file sync, share and view.

vulnerability_information:
Hi,

With this bug, a local attacker can infect users with malware. it
works this way, after the sign up page or most pages, a Download
prompt appears. (for example, at your Hackerone Page hackerone.com/owncloud),
However, the downloads url, in my case, it was 

http://download.owncloud.org/community/owncloud-daily-stable8.1.tar.bz2

Did you see what I see? the page is delievered by http. so an attacker
does this, downloads the file, bind a malware to it. host it to his
server, and when a legit user try to donwload it, deliever the payload
binded with the games. user runs that, game over. who's to blame?
well, duh... owncloud!

The easiest solution is just changing the URL from
http://download.owncloud.org/community/owncloud-daily-stable8.1.tar.bz2
to https://download.owncloud.org/community/owncloud-daily-stable8.1.tar.bz2
because the site works both ways, only... the second one gets
downloaded from an encrypted source. I don't even know why you put the
HTTP version anyways.

Note: I am doing this for the points, not the bounty. so please don't damage it.

Thanks again,
Paulos
vulnerability_information_html:
Hi,

With this bug, a local attacker can infect users with malware. it
works this way, after the sign up page or most pages, a Download
prompt appears. (for example, at your Hackerone Page hackerone.com/owncloud),
However, the downloads url, in my case, it was

http://download.owncloud.org/community/owncloud-daily-stable8.1.tar.bz2

Did you see what I see? the page is delievered by http. so an attacker
does this, downloads the file, bind a malware to it. host it to his
server, and when a legit user try to donwload it, deliever the payload
binded with the games. user runs that, game over. who's to blame?
well, duh... owncloud!

The easiest solution is just changing the URL from
http://download.owncloud.org/community/owncloud-daily-stable8.1.tar.bz2
to https://download.owncloud.org/community/owncloud-daily-stable8.1.tar.bz2
because the site works both ways, only... the second one gets
downloaded from an encrypted source. I don't even know why you put the
HTTP version anyways.

Note: I am doing this for the points, not the bounty. so please don't damage it.

Thanks again,
Paulos

activities.message:
Thanks a lot for reporting this potential issue back to us. We take security very seriously and would appreciate if you would not share any information about this bug until we have determined a potential patch.
 
Our security team will take a look at this issue as soon as possible. We will reply to your report within 72 hours, usually much faster.
activities.markdown_message:
Thanks a lot for reporting this potential issue back to us. We take security very seriously and would appreciate if you would not share any information about this bug until we have determined a potential patch.

Our security team will take a look at this issue as soon as possible. We will reply to your report within 72 hours, usually much faster.

activities.message: Thanks. We have adjusted the link on our HackerOne page.
activities.markdown_message: Thanks. We have adjusted the link on our HackerOne page.

activities.message:
@owncloud @lukasreschke can you please hold off the disclosure. most sites are still vulnearble for similar bug and this disclosure will hurt those reports.

Thanks,

activities.message:
Thanks a lot for your report. Please note that for the time being we do not award monetary rewards for bugs reported for our own website and infrastructure.

From our FAQ:
> **Q: Why do you exclude the ownCloud websites and infrastructure?**
> A: For the time being we want to focus our efforts on ownCloud Server instead of vulnerabilities within our website and infrastructure. However, if you find a security bug in our website or infrastructure we welcome any report, though we cannot offer a monetary incentive.

If you want to ensure that your submission are in-scope you might want to try the code available from https://owncloud.org/install/
activities.markdown_message:
Thanks a lot for your report. Please note that for the time being we do not award monetary rewards for bugs reported for our own website and infrastructure.

From our FAQ:

Q: Why do you exclude the ownCloud websites and infrastructure?
A: For the time being we want to focus our efforts on ownCloud Server instead of vulnerabilities within our website and infrastructure. However, if you find a security bug in our website or infrastructure we welcome any report, though we cannot offer a monetary incentive.

If you want to ensure that your submission are in-scope you might want to try the code available from https://owncloud.org/install/
